articles.headline: Ruling on Argentina Gives Investors an Upper Hand
articles.snippet: The ruling made it far less likely that genuinely troubled countries will be able to restructure their debts and increased the power of investors to prevent needed restructurings.
articles.abstract: The ruling made it far less likely that genuinely troubled countries will be able to restructure their debts and increased the power of investors to prevent needed restructurings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hard cases, it has often been said, make bad law.

articles.headline: Wisconsin Governor at Center of a Vast Fund-Raising Case
articles.snippet: Prosecutors in Wisconsin say Gov. Scott Walker was part of an effort to illegally coordinate fund-raising and spending between his campaign and outside groups, according to unsealed court filings.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors in Wisconsin say Gov. Scott Walker was part of an effort to illegally coordinate fund-raising and spending between his campaign and outside groups, according to unsealed court filings.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Prosecutors in Wisconsin assert that Gov. Scott Walker was part of an elaborate effort to illegally coordinate fund-raising and spending between his campaign and conservative groups during efforts to recall him and several state senators two years ago, according to court filings unsealed Thursday.
articles.byline: By Monica Davey and Nicholas Confessore

articles.headline: Buying Into Solar Power, No Roof Access Needed
articles.snippet: The so-called community solar garden was pioneered in Colorado, and is appealing to people who have no roof space, like renters and apartment owners, or homeowners with shady roofs.
articles.abstract: The so-called community solar garden was pioneered in Colorado, and is appealing to people who have no roof space, like renters and apartment owners, or homeowners with shady roofs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like many consumers, David Polstein had already done much to reduce energy use in his large Victorian home in Newton, Mass. He replaced his appliances with energy-efficient models, installed better heating and put in new insulation. But he was unable to get a solar system to reduce his utility bill, he said, because his roof is too small and shady to make it worthwhile.

articles.headline: Trial Secondary as U.S. Questions a Libyan Suspect
articles.snippet: The Libyan suspected of playing a key role in the deadly attack on the United States Mission in Benghazi is talking freely with American interrogators.
articles.abstract: The Libyan suspected of playing a key role in the deadly attack on the United States Mission in Benghazi is talking freely with American interrogators.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Libyan suspected of playing a key role in the deadly attack on the United States Mission in Benghazi is talking freely with American interrogators aboard a Navy ship in the Mediterranean Sea, according to senior American officials.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt, Matt Apuzzo, Eric Schmitt and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: G.O.P. Senator Courts Blacks in Mississippi Primary Race
articles.snippet: After being narrowly edged out by a Tea Party-backed challenger, Senator Thad Cochran needs to expand the number of voters who will show up for the Republican runoff election.
articles.abstract: After being narrowly edged out by a Tea Party-backed challenger, Senator Thad Cochran needs to expand the number of voters who will show up for the Republican runoff election.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — Inside an abandoned grocery store-turned-church here, a dozen black pastors gathered to discuss a seemingly impossible task: persuading their congregations to vote Republican next week.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Drug Maker AbbVie Joins a Stampede to Go Abroad
articles.snippet: An American drug company’s yet-unsuccessful attempts to purchase an Irish competitor make it the latest company to try to relocate through buyouts to a country with lower tax rates.
articles.abstract: An American drug company’s yet-unsuccessful attempts to purchase an Irish competitor make it the latest company to try to relocate through buyouts to a country with lower tax rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 7:08 p.m. | At first it was a trickle. A few relatively unknown pharmaceutical companies acquired international competitors, and moved their headquarters abroad.
articles.byline: By David Gelles and Chad Bray

articles.headline: 6 New Ways to Measure Your Financial Goals
articles.snippet: Some metrics that we cling to in our financial lives can end up being wildly counterproductive. But what should we replace them with?
articles.abstract: Some metrics that we cling to in our financial lives can end up being wildly counterproductive. But what should we replace them with?
articles.lead_paragraph: Most of us want goals to shoot for, but all too often we pick the wrong ones.
